title: Journalism-ICT Collaboration Project Using Innovative Teaching Methods: Enhancing Media Industry and Civic Engagement

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems, foundational understanding of the media industry (history, systems, economic structures), and proficiency in digital tools
context.additional_context: Conducted in a mobile BYOD environment, this project involves beginner learners in journalism and ICT collaborating to solve real-world media industry challenges. Aims to achieve civic engagement and social responsibility, including analysis of local and global media relationships.

learning_goals: Learners can generate at least three ideas integrating journalism and ICT in network/collaborative learning environments, considering the media industry’s social impact and strategies for enhancing citizen rights

Learners, working in groups of four, will complete a digital content prototype (e.g., educational app/web interface) linked to industry contexts within one week and submit a final product that meets at least three of the five evaluation criteria through a prototype demonstration and functional explanation (5 minutes) at the final presentation. This process must adhere to media ethics and data safety protocols.

Learners will select three latest media trends (e.g., AI-generated content, short-form video platforms), write a data-driven analysis report (approx. 1,000 characters), and create a 5-minute presentation. They must receive a grade of 'B+' or higher from at least two out of three peer evaluators. The analysis must consider cultural diversity and global media relations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
